gurmukhi: mwr lieE dlu Aaur BijE mn mY qb kop insuMB kirE hY ]
transliteration: Maar Laio Dal(u) Aur Bhajio Man Mai Tab Kop Nisounbh Kario Hai||
translation: When some army was killed and some fled away, then Nisumbh became very ferocious in his mind.

gurmukhi: cMf ky swmuhy Awin pirE Aiq ju`Du kirE pgu nwih tirE hY ]
transliteration: Channd Ke Saamuhe Aan(i0 Pario At(i) Juddh(u) Kario Pag(u) Naah(i) Tario Hai||
translation: He stood firmly before Chandi and waged a violent war, he did not recede even one step.

gurmukhi: cMf ky bwn ligE muK dYq ky sRaun smUh Drwn pirE hY ]
transliteration: Channd Ke Baan Lagio Moukh Dait Ke Sraoun Samoond Dharaan Pario Hai||
translation: The arrows of Chandi struck the faces of demons and great deal of blood hath flown on the earth.

gurmukhi: mwnhu rwhu gRisE nB Bwn su sRaunq ko Aiq baun kirE hY ]192]
transliteration: Maanoh Raahu Grasio Nabh Bhaan Su Sraounat Ko At(i) Baoun Kario Hai||192||
translation: It seems that Rahu hath caught hold of sun in the sky, resulting in the great carving of blood by the sun.192.

gurmukhi: swNg sMBwr krM blu Dwr kY cMf deI irp Bwl mY AYsy ]
transliteration: Saan Sanbhaar Karan Bal(u) Dhaar Kai Channd Daoo Rip Dhaal Mai Aise||
translation: Holding the spear in her hand, Chandi with great force thrust it into the forehead of the enemy like this,

gurmukhi: jor ky Por geI isrqRwn ko pwr BeI pt Pwr AnYsy ]
transliteration: Jor Ke Phor Gado Sirtraan Ko Paar Bhaoo Pat Phaar Anaise||
translation: That it pierced the helmet like the cloth.

gurmukhi: sRaun kI Dwr clI pQ aUrD so aupmw su BeI khu kYsy ]
transliteration: Sraoun Koo Dhaar Chaloo Path Ooradh So Oupmaa Su Bhaoo Kahu Kaise||
translation: The current of blood flowing out upwards, what comparison the poet hath imagined about it?

gurmukhi: mwno mhys ky qIsry nYn kI joq audyq BeI Kul qYsy ]193]
transliteration: Maano Mahes Ke Toodare Nain Koo Jot Udot Bhaoo Khul Taise||193||
translation: With the opening of the third eye of Shiva, the light appeared like this current.193.

gurmukhi: dYq inkws kY swNg vhY bil kY qb cMf pRcMf ky dInI ]
transliteration: Dait Nikaas Kai Saan Vahai Bal(i) Kai Tab Channd Prachanndd Ke Doonoo||
translation: The demon, with his strength, took out that spear and with the same swiftness struck Chandi with it.

gurmukhi: jwie lgy iqh ky muK mY bih sRaun pirE Aiq hI Cib kInI ]
transliteration: Jaae Lage Tih Ke Moukh Mai Bah(i) Sraoun Pario At(i) Hoo Chhab(i) Koonoo||
translation: The spear struck the face of the goddess resulting in the flow of blood from her face, which created a splendid scene.

gurmukhi: ieau aupmw aupjI mn mY kiv ny ieh BwNq soeI kih dInI ]
transliteration: Eeo Oupmaa Oupjoo Man Mai Kav(i) Ne Eh Bhaant Sooo Kah(i) Doonoo||
translation: The comparison which hath emerged in the mind of the poet, can be told like this:

gurmukhi: mwnhu isMgl dIp kI nwr gry mY qMbor kI pIk nvInI ]194]
transliteration: Maanoh Singad Doop Koo Naar Dare Mai Tanbor Koo Pook Navoonoo||194||
translation: I seemed that in the throat of the most beautiful woman of Lanka, the saliva of the chewed betel leaf is being visulised.194.

gurmukhi: ju`Du insuMB kirE Aiq hI jsu ieAw Cib ko kib ko brnY ]
transliteration: Juddh(u) Nisounbh Kario At(i) Hoo Jas(u) Iaa Chhab(i) Ko Kab(i) Ko Barnai||
translation: Nisumbh hath waged a very fierce war which poet can describe its splendour?
